Class Router

  • java.lang.Object
    • Router

  • public class Router
extends java.lang.Object
    The Router class represents a router. Each Router references its own routing algorithm class, whose name was provided in the constructor. A Router looks up the class from its name and instantiates it using java reflection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Router(int i, int n, java.lang.String c, int u, boolean pr, boolean e)
      Router constructor takes the router id, the number of interfaces, the class name of the routing algorithm to load and the update interval, in addition to two flags indicating the level of optimisation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Router

        public Router(int i,
              int n,
              java.lang.String c,
              int u,
              boolean pr,
              boolean e)
        Router constructor takes the router id, the number of interfaces, the class name of the routing algorithm to load and the update interval, in addition to two flags indicating the level of optimisation. If the routing algorithm class is not found, prints an exception.
        Parameters:
        i - router id
        n - number of interfaces
        c - class name of the routing algortihm to load.
        u - the update interval in seconds
        pr - if split horizon with poison reverse is enabled or not.
        e - if entry expiry is enabled or not.

      • send

        public void send(Packet p)
        Sends a packet, this method just calls the more complex send method below with an arguement -3 for the interface signifying that the packet is routed using the routing table. This is the default method to call.
        Parameters:
        p - Packet to sent.

      • send

        public void send(Packet p,
                 int iface)
        Sends a packet, either directly on an interface (if the interface is specified as a value other than -3) or looks the interface up in the routing table. If the interface is not known in the routing table -2 is returned and the packet is dropped. Each packet has a time to live specified which is used to drop packets if there are routing loops. If the time to live reaches 0 the packet is dropped.
        Parameters:
        p - the packet to send
        iface - the interface to send it on

      • recv

        public Packet recv(int iface)
        Receives a packet on the interface specified, if no packet is available null is returned.
        Parameters:
        iface - to check
        Returns:
        Packet next packet to receive on the interface.

      • go

        public void go()
        This method is called by the simulator each time step. It sends the routing table to all neighbours and processes all packets. We only send a rounting table every update_interval

      • dumpRoutingTable

        public void dumpRoutingTable()
        Dump the routing table to stdout

      • dumpPacketStats

        public void dumpPacketStats()
        Dump packet Stats to stdout for both the router and each link. s : sent , r : recv , d : drop , f : forw

        public int getNumInterfaces()

        Returns:
